Name: Figurine of Dionysos on a Chariot
Description: The terra-cotta statuette of the young Dionysos on a chariot full of grapes and pulled by two panthers is among the dozens of statuettes symbolizing childhood. His face is puffy and cheerful and the colors are still preserved. Dionysos is the god of wine, the inventor and teacher of the cultivation of grapes, the giver of joy, and the dispenser of sorrow.
